page.title: 20LIFE IN WINGATE VILLAGE
page.content: A Resident of Wingate Village was asked how life had changed in the 68 years that he had lived there. The village has expanded and yet houses have been knocked down. The biggest change came when the colliery closed in 1976 because, of course, many men lost their jobs. Transport has changed considerably. 60 years ago the push bike and horse and trap were common place. Char-a-bancs began to appear at this time too. People did not travel far then- the main event of the year was a trip to Newcastle. The houses 60 years ago had no electricity or running water. The toilets were outside earth toilets, they had no flushing mechanism. The event that remains a vivid memory in this resident's mind was the Second World War,and the school being bombed.
